    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Connections c)
        Uses the specified Connections object to Build the structural anatomy needed by this TemporalMemory to implement its algorithms. The connections object holds the Column and Cell infrastructure, and is used by both the SpatialPooler and TemporalMemory. Either of these can be used separately, and therefore this Connections object may have its Columns and Cells initialized by either the init method of the SpatialPooler or the init method of the TemporalMemory. We check for this so that complete initialization of both Columns and Cells occurs, without either being redundant (initialized more than once). However, Cells only get created when initializing a TemporalMemory, because they are not used by the SpatialPooler.
        Parameters:
        c - Connections object

      • compute

                            int[] activeColumns,
                            boolean learn)
        Feeds input record through TM, performing inferencing and learning
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        connections - the connection memory
        activeColumns - direct proximal dendrite input
        learn - learning mode flag
        Returns:
        ComputeCycle container for one cycle of inference values.

      • computeFn

        public ComputeCycle computeFn(Connections c,
                              java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns,
                              java.util.Set<Cell> prevPredictiveCells,
                              java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevActiveSegments,
                              java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                              java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells,
                              java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevMatchingSegments,
                              java.util.Set<Cell> prevMatchingCells,
                              boolean learn)
        Functional version of #compute(int[], boolean). This method is stateless and concurrency safe.
        Parameters:
        c - Connections object containing state of memory members
        activeColumns - active Columns in t
        prevPredictiveCells - cells predicting in t-1
        prevActiveSegments - active Segments in t-1
        prevActiveCells - active Cells in t-1
        prevWinnerCells - winner Cells in t-1
        prevMatchingSegments - matching Segments in t-1
        prevMatchingCells - matching cells in t-1
        learn - whether mode is "learning" mode
        Returns:

      • activateCorrectlyPredictiveCells

        public void activateCorrectlyPredictiveCells(Connections cnx,
                                             ComputeCycle c,
                                             java.util.Set<Cell> prevPredictiveCells,
                                             java.util.Set<Cell> prevMatchingCells,
                                             java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns)
        Phase 1: Activate the correctly predictive cells Pseudocode: - for each previous predictive cell - if in active column - mark it as active - mark it as winner cell - mark column as predicted - if not in active column - mark it as a predicted but inactive cell
        Parameters:
        cnx - Connectivity of layer
        c - ComputeCycle interim values container
        prevPredictiveCells - predictive Cells predictive cells in t-1
        activeColumns - active columns in t

      • burstColumns

        public void burstColumns(ComputeCycle cycle,
                         Connections c,
                         java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns,
                         java.util.Set<Column> predictedColumns,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells)
        Phase 2: Burst unpredicted columns. Pseudocode: - for each unpredicted active column - mark all cells as active - mark the best matching cell as winner cell - (learning) - if it has no matching segment - (optimization) if there are previous winner cells - add a segment to it - mark the segment as learning
        Parameters:
        cycle - ComputeCycle interim values container
        c - Connections temporal memory state
        activeColumns - active columns in t
        predictedColumns - predicted columns in t
        prevActiveCells - active Cells in t-1
        prevWinnerCells - winner Cells in t-1

      • learnOnSegments

        public void learnOnSegments(Connections c,
                            java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevActiveSegments,
                            java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> learningSegments,
                            java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                            java.util.Set<Cell> winnerCells,
                            java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells,
                            java.util.Set<Cell> predictedInactiveCells,
                            java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevMatchingSegments)
        Phase 3: Perform learning by adapting segments. 
         Pseudocode:

 - (learning) for each previously active or learning segment
   - if learning segment or from winner cell
     - strengthen active synapses
     - weaken inactive synapses
   - if learning segment
     - add some synapses to the segment
       - sub sample from previous winner cells
   
   - if predictedSegmentDecrement > 0
     - for each previously matching segment
       - weaken active synapses but don't touch inactive synapses
        Parameters:
        c - the Connections state of the temporal memory
        prevActiveSegments - the Set of segments active in the previous cycle. "t-1"
        learningSegments - the Set of segments marked as learning segments in "t"
        prevActiveCells - the Set of active cells in "t-1"
        winnerCells - the Set of winner cells in "t"
        prevWinnerCells - the Set of winner cells in "t-1"
        predictedInactiveCells - the Set of predicted inactive cells
        prevMatchingSegments - the Set of segments with

      • computePredictiveCells

        public void computePredictiveCells(Connections c,
                                   ComputeCycle cycle,
                                   java.util.Set<Cell> activeCells)
        Phase 4: Compute predictive cells due to lateral input on distal dendrites. Pseudocode: - for each distal dendrite segment with activity >= activationThreshold - mark the segment as active - mark the cell as predictive - if predictedSegmentDecrement > 0 - for each distal dendrite segment with unconnected activity > = minThreshold - mark the segment as matching - mark the cell as matching
        Parameters:
        c - the Connections state of the temporal memory
        cycle - the state during the current compute cycle
        activeCells - the active Cells in t

      • getBestMatchingCell

        public TemporalMemory.CellSearch getBestMatchingCell(Connections c,
                                                     java.util.List<Cell> columnCells,
                                                     java.util.Set<Cell> activeCells)
        Gets the cell with the best matching segment (see `TM.bestMatchingSegment`) that has the largest number of active synapses of all best matching segments. If none were found, pick the least used cell (see `TM.leastUsedCell`).
        Parameters:
        c - Connections temporal memory state
        columnCells -
        activeCells -
        Returns:
        a CellSearch (bestCell, BestSegment)
